crew/alora.html.title: Alora
crew/alora.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: She / Her Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Non-Player Character Status:: Commissioned NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Species:: Liberated Borg Role:: Nurse
Portrait:: Note:: Ex-Borg looking for a lost sense of connection
Found some kinship with Eelara, as they both need closeness.
Both Alora and Walter Beck have shared experiences on Frontier worlds. Alora grew up on a frontier colony world, where she leaned to take care of animals first, and then people. At some point, the borg invaded and Alora was assimilated.Sometime after that, Alora was liberated from the Borg. Since then, she found a career in Starfleet as a ship nurse. On the USS Alexandria, she has found kinship with both Eelara and

crew/andy-markham.html.title: Andy Markham
crew/andy-markham.html.description:
Note Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Player Character NumRank:: 3 Rank:: Lt. Commander Species:: Human Role:: Intelligence Officer Pronouns:: he/him
Portrait:: Note:: Recruited by Starfleet Intelligence and trusted by the captain Player:: David Andy and [Eelara] both agree: you cannot miss the nightly social functions on the USS Alexandria.
Relja Zecevic and Andy are both the type of people who take the initiative, but Andy's Starfleet Intelligence connections make him harder to trust for Relja.
T'Mel Marie Williamson tends to dislike Andy's tendency to look before he leaps. T'Mel will sometimes act as Andy's conscience.
Both Andy and Hemel Jiqari have had complicated relationships with their political parents, which they've bonded over.
Andy is a regular with Plek's counselling services.
Both Avery and Andy are members of Starfleet Intelligence, which comes with both mutual trust and distrust.
Captain Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Alexandria/Crew/Kala Cerjaso moved Andy into his current position in the Command division after recognizing Andy's potential as a leader. Table15 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNewFjFjFjFjFj

crew/avery-helsing.html.title: Avery Helsing
crew/avery-helsing.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: he/him Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Non-Player Character Status:: Commissioned NumRank:: 2 Rank:: Commander Species:: Human Role:: XO, Chief of Security
Portrait:: Note:: No nonsense commander with strong ties to Starfleet Intelligence
Second in command. Normally found in The Bridge. Assigned to the Alexandria on request from Starfleet Intelligence
Walter Beck reports directly to Helsing. In his command, Helsing tends to value the mission over the lives of the crew.
Both Helsing and Andy Markham as members of Starfleet Intelligence. This comes with with both mutual trust and distrust of each other.
Assigned to the ship against the wishes of Kala Cerjaso. Table0 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNew

crew/braag-lorin-pag.html.title: Braag lorin Pag
crew/braag-lorin-pag.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: he/him Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned Rank:: Lt. Commander NumRank:: 3 Species:: Tellarite Role:: Engineering Specialist
Portrait:: Note:: Previously covered Walter Beck's mistake before it went bad
Fixed a mistake for Walter Beck before it went bad.
Reports to Relja Zecevic

Info Location:: USS Alexandria Pronouns:: she/her NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned Species:: Human Role:: Security Assistant
Portrait:: Note:: Table0 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNew

crew/ceth.html.description:

Portrait:: Note:: Searching for a way to distance themselves from Romulan culture by joining Starfleet. Table4 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNewFjFjFjFjFj

crew/durall.html.title: Durall
crew/durall.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: he/him Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Non-Player Character NumRank:: 5 Status:: Commissioned Rank:: Lieutenant JG Species:: Trill Role:: Communications Officer
Portrait:: Note:: Got Eelara's preferred role on the ship. Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::
Durall has been a rival to Eelara, and took her preferred bridge position as the Communications Officer. Table0 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNew

crew/eelara.html.title: Eelara
crew/eelara.html.description:
Note Pronouns:: she/her Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Player Character NumRank:: 5 Rank:: Lieutenant JG Species:: Denobulan Role:: Operations Manager
Portrait:: Note:: A friendly face seeking wellbeing amongst the stars. Player:: Jessie Value1:: It's the journey, not the destination Value2:: Never stop learning Value3:: A good mystery is irresistible Value4:: Being friendly can get you far
Both Andy Markham and Eelara agree: you cannot miss the Alexandria's nightly social functions.
Eelara has a habit of trying to collaborate with Walter Beck when he'd rather work alone.
Relja Zecevic recognized Eelara's engineering talent and promoted her to the bridge as a "punishment"
Eelara and Plek both agree on a philosophy of wellness through play.
Eelara and Alora are "ship siblings". They both come from places where they are accustomed to a high level of closeness with the people around them. Alora misses the connection she felt as a Borg, and Eelara is a Denobulan.
Durall has been a rival to Eelara, and took her preferred bridge position as the Communications Officer.

crew/hemel-jiqari.html.title: Hemel Jiqari
crew/hemel-jiqari.html.description:
**Info Pronouns:: She/her Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: SC Status:: Civilian Rank:: Civilian Species:: Bajoran-Cardassian Role:: Passenger
Portrait:: Note:: Bonded with Andy Markham over having a difficulty relationship with their parents. Player:: David Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::
Bonded with Andy Markham over having a difficulty relationship with their parents.

crew/kala-cerjaso.html.title: Kala Cerjaso
crew/kala-cerjaso.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: She / Her Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned NumRank:: 1 Rank:: Captain Species:: Bajoran Role:: Commanding Officer
Portrait:: Note:: On her first assignment as captain and in over her head. Value1:: We all signed up knowing the risks Value2:: Value3:: Value4::
Cerjaso moved Andy Markham into the Command Division after recognizing his potential as a leader.
Avery Helsing was assigned to the Alexandra against Cerjaso's wishes as Starfleet Intelligence wanted to keep an eye on her and the situation.

crew/plek.html.title: Plek
crew/plek.html.description:
Plek## SummaryInfo Pronouns:: he/him Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Commissioned NumRank:: 4 Rank:: Lieutenant Species:: Ferengi Role:: Ship Councillor
Portrait:: Note:: Helps others find profit in their own wellbeing. Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::
Plek and Eelara agree on the important of mental wellbeing.
Andy Markham is a regular to visit Plek.
Walter Beck is working through some survivor's guilt after theri ship was destroyed.
Often helps coach the Renal Kayto on how to express themselves.

crew/relja-zecevic.html.title: Relja Zecevic
crew/relja-zecevic.html.description:
Note Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Player Character Rank:: Lt. Commander NumRank:: 3 Pronouns:: he/him Species:: Human Role:: Chief Engineer
Portrait:: Note:: A pragmatic, no-fuss engineer who takes the initiative. Value1:: Trust, but verify Value2:: Sensors can't tell you everything Value3:: Good Leaders get their hands dirty Value4:: The mission comes first
Walter Beck and Relja served on the same ship making an evacuation effort before the Romulus Supernova.
Relja and Andy Markham tend to agree on taking the initiative and acting quickly. But Relja has a hard time trusting Andy's Starfleet Intelligence background.
Relja recognized Eelara's engineering talent and promoted her to the bridge as a "punishment"
Braag lorin Pag Reports directly Relja.
Relja and Renal Kayto often enjoy sharing moments of silence on the otherwise hectic ship.
Reljia rescued Nitrina thinking she sought sanctuary ahead of the Romulus supernova. She ended up being a Tal Shiar agent who transmitted the names of Romulans seeking sanctuary back to Romulus. Picked up a Romulan refugee, ended up being a Tal-Shiar spy.
Nitrina was caught by Relja just after she transmitted the names of all the people seeking sanctuary back to Romulus. The plan of course to use any family that had remaining to force them to come back. Nitrina made her escape (transported off to a cloaked BoP) before Relja could stop her. Relja knew he had doomed those people and their families because he didn't stop the spy. This devastated him. Made worse by the fact that not long thereafter the ship itself gets destroyed Since the ship going down is Jeff's event, I don't wanna say directly that Nitrina was involved/responsible, but no matter what truth we settle on Relja as a character will think she absolutely had something to do with it, meaning Relja bears responsibility for it). So all that sends Relja into a spiral. His long time friend, the Alexandria's CMO, finally gets him back on his feet.

crew/t'mel-marie-williamson.html.title: T'Mel Marie Williamson
crew/t'mel-marie-williamson.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: She/her Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Supporting Character Status:: Civilian NumRank: 10 Rank:: N/A Species:: Human-Vulcan Role:: Anthropology Expert
Portrait:: Note:: Xeno-Anthropologist who prefers caution over daring decision making. Player:: David Value1:: Value2:: Value3:: Value4::
Close associates with Andy Markham, who she thinks acts too brashly.

crew/walter-beck.html.title: Walter Beck
crew/walter-beck.html.description:
Info Pronouns:: he / him Location:: USS Alexandria Type:: Player Character NumRank:: 8 Status:: Enlisted Rank:: Petty Officer Third Class Species:: Human Role:: Security Specialist
Portrait:: Note:: A battle hardened medic who gets the job done. Player:: Jeff Value1:: Security is more than just a job Value2:: Willing to sacrifice myself to save my crew Value3:: A Starship is nothing without its crew Value4:: Stand up against Injustice
Walter saved Relja Zecevic's life when their ship was destroyed.
Eelara ha a habit of trying to collaborate with Walter when he'd rather work alone.
Braag lorin Pag fixed a mistake Walter made on a mission before it went bad, saving Walter's career
Alora and Walter work closely together in the sick bay. They are also both from frontier worlds and understand what it takes to be self sufficient.
Walter talks to Plek about his traumatic experience having his ship blown up.
Walter reports directly to Avery Helsing, who always insists that the mission comes first, sometimes even above casualties. Table9 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNewFjFjFjFjFj

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 0 - Session 0
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: Alexandria Web Alexandria Mind Map

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 1.1 - Bacchus-3
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: The USS Alexandria arrived at Bacchus 3, where they discovered Romulans trying to activate some ancient alien ruins. The Romulans have had no contact with the outside for quite some time.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 1.2 - Bacchus 3
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: The away team on Bacchus 3 managed to deactivate the planet's subspace distortion waves, and recover a tricorder full of valuable information with it.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 2.1 - Orion Heist
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: USS Alexandria chased down an Orion freighter to recover a Tilikaal artifact. But as soon as it was recovered, a Romulan Warbird de-cloaked nearby.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 2.2 - Boarded
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: The crew fended off a Romulan boarding party while using using the artifact to boost the ship's shields subspace distortion capabilities. This lead to the ship being plunged deep into subspace temporarily.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 3 - Peas to Meet You
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: While transporting some colonists from the Re-Alpha System to the Yacci System, a fruit called "ice peas" caused many crew members to behave in erratic and strange ways. The crew was able to identify the cause as an allergic reaction and mitigated it by introducing a local mycelium to the ice peas transport substrate.
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Alexandria/Sessions/Summaries/Season 1/Alexandria Log 3 - Peas to Meet You.md

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 4.1 - Simplicity
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: The USS Alexandria was intercepted by Rear Admiral Banna Stoker in a beat up Romulan shuttle. The Admiral then ordered the Alexandria to send an away team down to Pasqual-1 to search for signs of the Tilikaal. On the planet, the away team activated a Tilikaal device by accident, which electrocuted the locals on the planet. Meanwhile, a Romulan warbird IRW Adjacium warped into the Pasqual system and demanded the Admiral be beamed to them and claimed the Admiral to be under Tilikaal influence.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 4.2 - Complexity
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: While the away team on Pasqual-1 investigated the strange electromagnetic field on the planet, the Alexandria was attack by a Romulan scout ship. The Romulans demanded custody of Admiral Banna Stoker, claiming that Stoker had stolen from them. After a brief firefight, the Romulan ship was disabled.Stoker was interrogated by Lt. Commander Markham, who discovered that Stoker was searching for evidence of more Tilikaal artifacts, claiming that her son had exhibited signs of Tilikaal influence and that Starfleet had covered it up. Ultimately, Stoker was arrested for attempting to destroy the Romulans in cold blood.On the Romulan ship, Relja encountered an old nemesis of his, a Tal Shiar agent who had betrayed him. Reluctantly, he repaired the scout ships broken singularity drive and let them go.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 4.3 - Ground Team
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: While the Alexandria contended wit the Romulan scout ship above, the away team was captured and put on trial by the locals on Pasqual-1. A dozen Pasqualians were killed by the obelisk's attempt to administer a genetic evolution advancement. In the end, the away team was found innocent of murder.They then went back to the obelisk, where a village elder named Jasper became amazed at the team's expertise in using it. They deactivated the obelisk, and Jasper offered to bring them to a holy site where the electromagnetic field would not affect them. This place was on the top of a mountain. On the way up, they were attack by mountain lion like creatures, and beamed up to the Alexandria as soon as they reach the peak. Jasper never got an explanation of the away team's visit, and watched them be carried away by golden light.While the Alexandria faced a Romulan scout in orbit, the away team on Pasqual-1 was captured, tried for the obelisk’s failed “genetic advancement” that killed twelve locals, and ultimately found innocent. They then deactivated the obelisk; elder Jasper, impressed, guided them toward a mountaintop holy site beyond the electromagnetic interference. After fending off mountain-lion-like predators, the team reached the peak and was immediately beamed away, leaving Jasper without answers as he watched them vanish in golden light.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 5.1 - Border Dispute
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: The USS Alexandria was asked by Starfleet Command to respond to a distress call from the USS Nightingale, a nova class science ship. The ship had come a little too close to an uncontacted Romulan planet and was fired upon. A Romulan warbird was claiming the crew of the Nightingale as war prisoners.Captain Cerjaso negotiated permission to send a team aboard the Nightingale to check for survivors and wounded. While performing repairs, the boarding party uncovered a Romulan disguised as a Vulcan named T'Lek amongst the crew. T'Lek attempted to escape to the Warbird, but was apprehended and beamed aboard the Alexandria after being caught stealing data from the Nightingale sensor array computers.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 5.2 - Imposter
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: With the Romulan spy T’Lek in the Alexandria’s brig, Lt. Cmdr. Markham began an interrogation to find out who they are and what they wanted from the USS Nightingale. Meanwhile, the away team on the Nightingale was tasked with securing the ship in case of another attack. The Romulans did decide to beam aboard the Nightingale in hopes of getting T’Lek.T’Lek never revealed their intentions, but Markham decided to return T’Lek to the Romulan Warbird to prevent and further casualties on the Nightingale. Afterwards, the Alexandria was given permission to leave the system safely with the Nightingale in tow.Eelara uncovered the data stolen by T’Lek: a list of systems the Nightingale was ordered to survey by Admiral Banna Stoker.

sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 6 - Court Martial
sessions/summaries/season-1/alexandria-l.description: After weeks of preparation, the court martial for Banna Stoker was set to begin. The defense attorney was a Ferengi names Loxor, and Andy Markham took up the role of prosecutor. Plek investigated Banna Stoker's medical history and performed a psychoanalysis. He found a "fundy loop" in her brain: a short chain of neurons that fired in a loop, just enough to repeat an idea. The frequency of these brainwaves matched some of the background subspace activity found in the Bacchus system. With this information, Plek gave witness, telling the court about Stoker's condition. This brought to light the true potential of some alien influence on Stoker, even without her knowing.Loxor made the case that Stoker was only acting in the interest of Starfleet's highest ideals. She answered the call of duty, doing everything in her power to protect what she believed to be an alien civilization in peril. In addition, many of Stoker actions could be justified given her rank as admiral. The rank gives a high degree of autonomy and ability to make judgement calls without consulting her superiors.Cmdr. Markham argued that Stoker presented a danger to the federation, having gone behind their back and put Federation officers in danger while keeping Starfleet command in the dark. Worst of all, when Stoker suspected that Starfleet would try to stop her from contacting the Tilikaal, she turned to people in the fractured Romulan Empire.In the end, Stoker was court martialed and sent backto earth to spend time with her son. While Starfleet was confident that she was no longer fit to lead in Starfleet, the trial was not able to bring to light exactly what threat the Tilikaal might pose. In particular, Stoker's son, Avery, seems to have suffered from the same alien influence as his mother. But without access to the Tilikaal artifact, it's unclear how Avery become infected with the influence at all.

sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 8.1 - Abyss Station
sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.description: The Alexandria was sent to follow a Tal'Shiar agent to the Omega Draconis System. There, they found single rocky planet with no atmosphere but a series of underground structures about approximately 300 life signs. There was also a large space station made of obsidian-black neutronium. The Romulan warbird was also there.As the Alexandria arrived, the black hole suddenly seemed to rotate. Massive high powered radiation jets moved to expel along the galactic plane. The planet, and all ~300 people on it, stood to be annihilated. One away team went down to the planet to start an evacuation, while another went into the space station to investigate what influence it has on the black whole and see what the Romulans were doing.The team on the planet found a small group of pale humanoids with space travel capabilities but no warp capability. They spoke about how they had spent a very long gazing into the abyss waiting for the time when the abyss would gaze back at them. They seemed unconcerned about the radiation jets.Meanwhile, a rescue team infiltrated the alien space station. Inside, they found large and humanoid-shaped automatons and a series of passageways leading into the center of the station. They also found a center with cloning vats full of people much like those on the surface of the planet. At the center, they took control of one of the automatons, and then opened the door to the control room. Inside, Romulans worked to take control of the station. Seeing the away team, the Romulans opened fire.

sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 8.2 - Taking Control of the Station
sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.description: As the away team on Abyss Station breached the control room, Romulan agents opened fire, determined to maintain control of the station's immense power. Relja ducked behind cover, exchanging fire while Alora scrambled to reprogram two humanoid automatons, nicknaming them Dave and Rimmer, to join the fight. Relja charged through disruptor fire to tackle Nitrina, pinning her underfoot. The automatons managed to knock the rest of the Romulans unconscious.Tropp and Alora turned to the consoles, where the alien controls depicted black hole rotation, subspace geometry, and massive energy distribution. They rerouted power using a makeshift circuit overlay to interpret the alien interface and managed to reverse the rotation of the radiation jets. They found an additional function of the station was that it could construct planets by siphoning mass from the Black Hole, though the process would take a year.While Tropp and Relja held down the control room, Alora and Plek explored the station further. They came across a cloning facilityIn the cloning facility with around a dozen clones in vats. They had pitch-black skin like a starfield. They began releasing the clones, knowing they couldn't leave them here for when the station would be destroyed. One called themselves Akkara, just like the mayor on the planet. Using the control room consoles, Tropp discovered that the clones in stasis were a more recent generation: version 4. They had been dormant for nearly a thousand years, while Version 3 on the planet was older still.Unwilling to wait for a new world to be fabricated, the team began preparing the evacuation. The rest of the crew began loading into shuttles with captured Romulans and confused Ithik clones.
sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Alexandria/Sessions/Summaries/Season 2/Alexandria Log 8.2 - Taking Control of the Station.md

sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 8.3 - Chaktir
sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.description: The away team on Chaktir failed to convince the Ithik people to evacuate, but thankfully the radiation jets were stopped. The Ithik blamed the crew for preventing their holy ascension. The away team on the station decided to evacuate the clones on the station and bring them back to Narendra Station until a more permanent solution was found.The away team on the planet Chaktir in in the Omega Draconis System, met the locals. They were led by Mayor Akkara and several ministers. They believed the black hole’s shifting radiation jets would elevate them to a higher state of existence. The crew attempted diplomacy through individual ministers, gathering evidence that the colony had survived previous solar catastrophes by retreating underground, but their faith in remaining was absolute.Walter Beck submitted to a medical scan with the Minister of Wellness, Vodlin. They were confused about humans having no nanoprobes to protect them. They offered a treatment involving a nanoprobe infusion, Which Walter accepted. Walter was quickly assaulted by the nanoprobes but maintained control of his mind.Soon, tremors began and radiation levels spiked, the away team prepared to evacuate critical personnel and preserve scientific records in case the colony refused to leave. But suddenly, the tremors stopped. And Mayor Akkara accused the away team of angering the Abyss.Ceth gave a comm badge to Mayor Akkara, saying that they would stay in touch in the future. Then the away team boarded their shuttle and left the planet.Back on the Neutronium station, Allora and Pleck discovered a cloning facility containing multiple generations of clones. The people on the planet Chaktir where marked as version 3 on a console, while the clones on the station where marked as version 4 and had been in stasis for nearly a thousand years.The facility contained advanced controls capable of constructing entire planets by drawing mass from the black hole, a process estimated to take one year. Unwilling to wait a year in the time-dilation to give the clones a new home, the station team decided to evacuate and bring the clones back to Narendra station temporarily. The crew split between two shuttles, loading some of the clones and the team of captured Romulans. They set the orbital decay to that it would fall into the black hole and be destroyed. On the way back to the Alexandria, they feared the Romulans may attack.

sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 8.4 - Escape From the Abyss
sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.description: After stabilizing the black hole’s radiation jets and setting Abyss Station on a decaying orbit, the Alexandria crew quickly evacuated. Three shuttles launched, carrying Starfleet officers, Romulan prisoners, and a confused group of newly awakened clones. The Federation shuttle was disguised as a sensor ghost to avoid detection. The two other shuttles were Romulan. When the Romulan Warbird decloaked, Relja hit it with an improvised energy disrupting beam to stall them, and the shuttles made a mad dash for the Alexandria's shuttle bay.With all Federation personnel and clones aboard, the Alexandria ejected the two Romulan shuttles to avoid breaking the treaty of Algernon and warped away from the Omega Draconis system.Once safe, the crew brought the clones, including one who claimed to be Akkara, to the restaurant/bar of the ship. From there, the crew decided to house them in a holosuite simulating their original environment, buying time until Starfleet Command could determine their fate.Meanwhile, Relja visited Nitrina in the brig for a cold, personal confrontation. He wanted closure, not confessions. Nitrina seemed confident she would be released later as part of a diplomatic exchange, escaping true justice. Later, Ceth made a different choice: leaving Nitrina with a hidden one-way communicator to a secret contact that could help her, mission data from Omega Draconis, and a silent offer to escape.In the final stage, Andy Markham and Tropp located a planet in Ferengi space with eerily similar conditions to Chaktir. The clones, guided by Ceth, were offered the chance to start anew there. After some discussion with Akkara about the authenticity of this new location and how it related to their faith, they accepted. Once the Alexandria returned to Narendra Station, the clones would be relocated to their new home in Federation space.
sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.sourcePath: Shackleton Expanse/Groups/Alexandria/Sessions/Summaries/Season 2/Alexandria Log 8.4 - Escape From the Abyss.md

sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 9.1 - Convoy SE-119
sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.description:
The USS Alexandria returned to Narendra station with clones from the Omega Draconis system and handed them over to Starfleet for resettlement nearby Ferengi space. The crew then had time to enjoy some downtime:
Tropp studied a potentially sentient but microscopic biolumeniscent species in his lab. A visiting Ithik clone named Akkara quietly observed their light-pulse “language.” Relja decompressed with boxing (and secretly, ballet) before being interrupted by Braag-Lorin Pag, looking for Stem Bolts.
Ceth lined up better suppliers. In the year that the Alexandria had been away, the station had new leadership: Admiral April Hebert. She and General Kargan briefed the crew alongside Romulan Commander Talis: a high-risk relief convoy must cross newly claimed Vinshari space, where subspace eddies make travel unpredictable.To prepare, Relja proposed synchronized drive profiles so that if any one ship dropped out of warp, they all would.In the Expanse, captain Akul's Bird of Prey his a subspace eddy and nearly lost warp. A Vinshari sailship appeared from behind a subpace turbulence, hailed with “Power is our right,” then 3 more ships appeared in and attack formation. Cerjaso answered, stating the mission was humanitarian and meant no harm.The Vinshari attacked anyways and disrupted the warp field of a freighter, causing it to drop out of warp and dragging the whole convoy with it. The Alexandria stayed behind with the freighters while the Klingon Bird of Prey and the Romulan Warbird sped ahead to deal with 2 Vinshari warships.A single Vinshari warship stayed behind to attack the freighters and deployed 6 single person fighters. Alexandria went to red alert and moved to shield the freighters as the engagement began.

sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.title: Alexandria Log 9.2 - Ha'kiv
sessions/summaries/season-2/alexandria-l.description: The Vinshari hit the convoy hard. The Klingon and Romulan escorts broke off to handle their own fights while Alexandria stayed on the freighters. A Vinshari raider slipped to the front, dropped a freighter’s shields, and harpooned it to drag it out of formation. Captain Cerjaso ordered Commander Markham to fire phasers.Ceth pinpointed a shield weakness and Relja pushed extra power to weapons. The volley punched straight through and disabled the raider in one shot. Captain Cerjaso then hailed the swarm and talked the fighters into returning to their carrier. As the dust settled, Ceth and Markham pressed Vinshari Captain Elra-Va to accept help. Relja assembled an away team with repair parts and boarded under truce.Aboard the Vinshari cruiser, Captain Elra-Va led the team to the “engine room.” Their power source was a Ha’kiv: about a slug about twenty meters long, pearlescent, tentacled, restrained and wired into the ship. Scans showed high-level problem solving, if not full personhood.The Vinshari needed parts to keep it subdued and stable. The away team split: some wanted to free the creature; others argued for stabilizing the ship and building a diplomatic relationship. They chose to stall and to show another path. Relja walked the Vinshari engineer DavenRi-Va through the Alexandria’s warp core, calling it an “artificial Ha’kiv,” and offered a template the Vinshari could study instead of using living engines. Meanwhile, Commander Markham spoke with Elra-Va about strengthening the relationship between the Vinshari and the Federation. Elra-Va told Markham that the Vinshari planned to break apart and overthrow the Romulan Empire, and Markham agreed this was something Starfleet, or at the least Alexandria, was aligned on.Ceth had a similar conversation with a Vinshari engineer, who said they were looking for allies who wanted to free the Ha'kiv and end the Vinshari's reliance on living things for power. They told Ceth that if they ever met more Vinshari, they should seek out the Ar-Ka-Se.While the talks dragged, the sedation window closed. The Ha’kiv woke, strained against its bonds (previously weakened by science officer Tropp), and tore free. It burst out of containment and fled into open space.

alexandria-episodes.html.title: Alexandria Episodes
alexandria-episodes.html.description: All Seasons19 resultsSort0Filter0PropertiesNew1.0 - Session 0-Alexandria Log 0 - Session 0-The crew of the USS Alexandria was assembled and briefed for their first exploratory mission into Romulan territory.1.1 - Bacchus' Irresistible Call-Alexandria Log 1.1 - Bacchus-3- The USS Alexandria arrived at Bacchus 3, where they discovered Romulans trying to activate some ancient alien ruins. The Romulans have had no contact with the outside for quite some time.-Alexandria Log 1.2 - Bacchus 3-The away team on Bacchus 3 managed to deactivate the planet's subspace distortion waves, and recover a tricorder full of valuable information with it.1.2 - The Orion Heist-Alexandria Log 2.1 - Orion Heist-The USS Alexandria chased down an Orion freighter to recover a Tilikaal artifact. But as soon as it was recovered, a Romulan Warbird de-cloaked nearby.-Alexandria Log 2.2 - Boarded-The crew fended off a Romulan boarding party while using using the artifact to boost the ship's shields subspace distortion capabilities. This lead to the ship being plunged deep into subspace temporarily.1.3 - Peas to Meet You-Alexandria Log 3 - Peas to Meet You-While transporting some colonists from the [[Re-Alpha System]] to the [[Yacci System]], a fruit called "ice peas" caused many crew members to behave in erratic and strange ways. The crew was able to identify the cause as an allergic reaction and mitigated it by introducing a local mycelium to the ice peas transport substrate.1.4 - Simplicity-Alexandria Log 4.1 - Simplicity- The USS Alexandria was intercepted by Rear Admiral Banna Stoker in a beat up Romulan shuttle. The Admiral then ordered the Alexandria to send an away team down to Pasqual-1 to search for signs of the Tilikaal. On the planet, the away team activated a Tilikaal device by accident, which electrocuted the locals on the planet. Meanwhile, a Romulan warbird IRW Adjacium warped into the Pasqual system and demanded the Admiral be beamed to them and claimed the Admiral to be under Tilikaal influence.-Alexandria Log 4.2 - Complexity-The Alexandria disabled a Romulan scout that demanded custody of Admiral Banna Stoker. The away team investigated Pasqual-1’s strange EM field. Markham’s interrogation revealed Stoker was hunting Tilikaal artifacts due to her son’s suspected influence. Aboard the disabled ship, Relja faced a Tal Shiar nemesis, repaired their singularity drive, and reluctantly let them go.-Alexandria Log 4.3 - Ground Team-The Alexandria faced a Romulan scout while the Pasqual-1 away team was captured, tried over an obelisk’s fatal “genetic advancement” that killed twelve. They were acquitted, and then deactivated the device. The village elder named Jasper led them toward a mountaintop holy site. After being attacked by predators, they reached the peak and were suddenly beamed away, leaving Jasper without answers.1.5 - Border Dispute-Alexandria Log 5.1 - Border Dispute-Starfleet sent the USS Alexandria to answer the USS Nightingale’s distress call after it was attacked near an uncontacted Romulan world. Captain Cerjaso secured permission to board for rescue and repairs, where the team exposed a Romulan spy, T’Lek, posing as a Vulcan. T’Lek was caught stealing sensor data, tried to flee to the Warbird, and was apprehended.-Alexandria Log 5.2 - Imposter-Markham interrogated Romulan spy T’Lek aboard the Alexandria while an away team secured the USS Nightingale amid a Romulan attempt to beam aboard and reclaim T’Lek. When T’Lek refused to reveal their motives, Markham returned them to the Warbird to prevent further casualties, and the Alexandria departed safely with the Nightingale in tow. Afterward, Eelara discovered the stolen data: Admiral Banna Stoker’s list of systems assigned to the Nightingale for survey.1.6 - Order in Court-Alexandria Log 6 - Court Martial-During the court martial trial of Banna Stoker, the defense attorney Loxor argued that Stoker was acting within her privileges as Admiral to rescue a people in peril. Andy argued that Stoker was a danger to the Federation, having gone to the Romulans for help, instead of Starfleet command. Stoker was court martialed and sent back to earth.2.1 - Imminent Collision-Alexandria Log 7 - Imminent Collision-After Narendra Station picked up an unidentified object approaching the station at high warp speeds, the Alexandria was sent to investigate while the station prepared for a potential attack. They found a strange crystalline starship and started rudimentary and cooperative communication with it. The crew found an unidentified torpedo lodged into the side of the crystalline structure, seemingly made just for the purpose of attacking this kind of starship. Once the torpedo was removed, the aliens in the ship revealed themselves: strange crystal beings who communicated through light refraction. They said thank you, and then left.2.2 - Abyss Station-Alexandria Log 8.1 - Abyss Station- The Alexandria followed a Romulan Warbird to a black hole with a neutronium lined space station and a singular rocky planet orbiting it. The planet had strange cultist gazing at the black hole waiting for the day it would "gaze back". The black hole was rotating to annihilate the planet with its radiation jets. On the station, the Alexandria's away team attacked a Romulan party on board.-Alexandria Log 8.2 - Taking Control of the Station-The Alexandria’s station team fought Romulans inside the neutronium structure and gained control of the central systems. With a makeshift circuit overlay, they stabilized the black hole’s radiation jets and discovered a cloning facility containing newer versions of the Ithik people. Rather than wait a year to construct a new world, the crew prepared to evacuate with the clones, setting the station on a decaying orbit and racing for extraction.-Alexandria Log 8.3 - Chaktir-The away team on Chaktir failed to convince the Ithik to evacuate, but the black hole’s radiation jets were successfully stopped. Tensions rose when the Ithik accused the crew of disrupting their prophesied “ascension,” while Walter Beck underwent an nanoprobe infusion offered by the Ithik doctor. Meanwhile, the Abyss Station team discovered a thousand-year-old cloning facility, evacuated the surviving clones, and set the station on orbital decay before leaving the station on both a Federation and Romulan Shuttle.-Alexandria Log 8.4 - Escape From the Abyss-After escaping the collapsing neutronium station, the Alexandria crew snuck past the Romulan Warbird onto the Alexandria and warped away. The clones were placed in a holosuite while a permanent home was found. Ceth offered Nitrina a quiet chance to disappear. In the end, the crew discovered a suitable planet in Ferengi space, and the clones accepted their new beginning.

uss-alexandria.html.title: USS Alexandria
uss-alexandria.html.description:
USS Alexandria Summary Location:: Romulan Star Empire, The Shackleton Expanse Type:: Ship
Portrait:: The NCC-65337-B: An exploration vessel assigned to the Romulan Star Empire in the Beta Quadrant.
A Federation New Orleans starship commanded by Kala Cerjaso. The Alexandria is outfitted for scout missions and pathfinding. It pushes into the edges of Federation space, makes first contact with new civilizations, and reports on astral phenomena. The crew is trained for a wide variety of circumstances, from diplomatic missions to emergency response. Federation Ship New Orleans Class Hope Ship Intelligence Division The USS Alexandria is the 2nd ship of its name. The original Alexandria was a vessel focused on making second contact. In particular, it was instrumental in maintaining an ongoing relationship with the Arcadians, who later became Federation council members.The current NCC-65337-B Alexandria was commissioned in 2373 and was assigned to explore Romulan space after a gaining favor with Romulans for it's attempts to evacuate Romulus before the Supernova
Most recently, the Alexandria was posted in the Romulan Star Empire after recent treaties granted passage to the Federation in the region. Although it is primarily an exploration vessel, a portion of the crew was assigned by Starfleet Intelligence as a counter measure to potential Romulan aggression. Among these crew members is first officer Avery Helsing, who was assigned without the captain's approval.SEASON 1 List View11 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNew SEASON 2 List View7 resultsSort1Filter1PropertiesNew Season 1
Alexandria Log 0 - Session 0: Stardate -, Session: 0The crew of the USS Alexandria was assembled and briefed for their first exploratory mission into Romulan territory.
Alexandria Log 1.1 - Bacchus-3: Stardate -, Session: 1 The USS Alexandria arrived at Bacchus 3, where they discovered Romulans trying to activate some ancient alien ruins. The Romulans have had no contact with the outside for quite some time.
Alexandria Log 1.2 - Bacchus 3: Stardate -, Session: 2The away team on Bacchus 3 managed to deactivate the planet's subspace distortion waves, and recover a tricorder full of valuable information with it.
Alexandria Log 2.1 - Orion Heist: Stardate -, Session: 3The USS Alexandria chased down an Orion freighter to recover a Tilikaal artifact. But as soon as it was recovered, a Romulan Warbird de-cloaked nearby.
Alexandria Log 2.2 - Boarded: Stardate -, Session: 4The crew fended off a Romulan boarding party while using using the artifact to boost the ship's shields subspace distortion capabilities. This lead to the ship being plunged deep into subspace temporarily.
Alexandria Log 3 - Peas to Meet You: Stardate -, Session: 5
While transporting some colonists from the Re-Alpha System to the Yacci System, a fruit called "ice peas" caused many crew members to behave in erratic and strange ways. The crew was able to identify the cause as an allergic reaction and mitigated it by introducing a local mycelium to the ice peas transport substrate.
Alexandria Log 4.1 - Simplicity: Stardate -, Session: 6 The USS Alexandria was intercepted by Rear Admiral Banna Stoker in a beat up Romulan shuttle. The Admiral then ordered the Alexandria to send an away team down to Pasqual-1 to search for signs of the Tilikaal. On the planet, the away team activated a Tilikaal device by accident, which electrocuted the locals on the planet. Meanwhile, a Romulan warbird IRW Adjacium warped into the Pasqual system and demanded the Admiral be beamed to them and claimed the Admiral to be under Tilikaal influence.
Alexandria Log 4.2 - Complexity: Stardate -, Session: 7The Alexandria disabled a Romulan scout that demanded custody of Admiral Banna Stoker. The away team investigated Pasqual-1’s strange EM field. Markham’s interrogation revealed Stoker was hunting Tilikaal artifacts due to her son’s suspected influence. Aboard the disabled ship, Relja faced a Tal Shiar nemesis, repaired their singularity drive, and reluctantly let them go.
Alexandria Log 4.3 - Ground Team: Stardate -, Session: 8The Alexandria faced a Romulan scout while the Pasqual-1 away team was captured, tried over an obelisk’s fatal “genetic advancement” that killed twelve. They were acquitted, and then deactivated the device. The village elder named Jasper led them toward a mountaintop holy site. After being attacked by predators, they reached the peak and were suddenly beamed away, leaving Jasper without answers.
Alexandria Log 5.1 - Border Dispute: Stardate -, Session: 9Starfleet sent the USS Alexandria to answer the USS Nightingale’s distress call after it was attacked near an uncontacted Romulan world. Captain Cerjaso secured permission to board for rescue and repairs, where the team exposed a Romulan spy, T’Lek, posing as a Vulcan. T’Lek was caught stealing sensor data, tried to flee to the Warbird, and was apprehended.
Alexandria Log 5.2 - Imposter: Stardate -, Session: 10Markham interrogated Romulan spy T’Lek aboard the Alexandria while an away team secured the USS Nightingale amid a Romulan attempt to beam aboard and reclaim T’Lek. When T’Lek refused to reveal their motives, Markham returned them to the Warbird to prevent further casualties, and the Alexandria departed safely with the Nightingale in tow. Afterward, Eelara discovered the stolen data: Admiral Banna Stoker’s list of systems assigned to the Nightingale for survey.
Alexandria Log 6 - Court Martial: Stardate -, Session: 11During the court martial trial of Banna Stoker, the defense attorney Loxor argued that Stoker was acting within her privileges as Admiral to rescue a people in peril. Andy argued that Stoker was a danger to the Federation, having gone to the Romulans for help, instead of Starfleet command. Stoker was court martialed and sent back to earth. Season 2
Imminent Collision: Stardate -, Session: --
Abyss Station: Stardate -, Session: --
Convoy SE-119: Stardate -, Session: -- The Alexandria is equipped with dozens of shuttles. Some notable ones are listed below!

info_showCustomIcons.description: Show custom icons for files and folders

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_displayTitle.description: Descriptive title to show above the feature

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
